latestPosts.caption:
At The Postcard in the Durrung Tea Estate in Assam, @thepostcarddurrungteaestate @thepostcardhotel, I’ve found joy in the pauses, the waiting, the watching. 

Over the past couple of days, Ishita Sitwala @ishifishy and I have been shooting the property. While it was a part of work (and the reason why we are here) it was also grounding, and at times exhilarating. I’m obsessed with the light teal railing that wraps around the spiral staircase in a restored 1950s bungalow, a two-storey colonial relic. That shade of teal feels deliberate — like an ode to colonial colour palettes softened by time and light. As put into words by Kapil Chopra, Founder and Chief Executive Officer at The Postcard Hotel, “Our vision was to craft the finest tea experience in the world and there was no better place to begin than the magnificent 1,400-acre Durrung Tea Estate in Assam. Here we invite our guests to journey through the complete story of tea — from the first leaf on the bush to the final perfect sip.” 

Tour the space from the link in our bio 🔗

Text by Shriti Das @s.h.r.i.t.i
Photography by Ishitta Sitwala @ishifishy

taggedUsers.full_name: The Postcard in the Durrung tea Estate

latestPosts.caption:
Think: endless tea gardens, trains slicing through the landscape and birds making the verandah their playground every morning. I’m not a morning person, but a trip to The Postcard @thepostcarddurrungteaestate @thepostcardhotel at Durrung Tea Estate in Assam has flipped the script. 

The Postcard occupies 5 acres within a 1,400 acre tea estate with 12 chalets, rooms and suites. We stayed in the newer chalets that are built in the traditional Chang style — a colonial-era stilted construction. Conventionally, they were designed to protect against wild animals and flooding. My bathtub was strategically placed in the centre overlooking a tall window where a single beam of sunlight poured in every morning, illuminating it. That’s when I first spotted Ishita Sitwala @ishifishy in the distance beaming behind her lens. “I now know why the tea-pluckers wear such thick clothes,” she said. “My legs are scratched to bits. But look at these shots, aren’t they amazing?” Unlike us, who chose to wander off into the 19th-century tea estate unhinged, unsupervised and unchaperoned, the property organises tea trails and tastings, taking great pride in producing some of the finest teas in the world. #JuneJuly2025

Tour the space from the link in our bio 🔗

Text by Shriti Das @s.h.r.i.t.i
Photography by Ishita Sitwala @ishifishy
